headline: ‘O.K., Boomer’ and Baking Spice Up an Age Bias Case
abstract: A lively Supreme Court argument on protecting federal workers from age discrimination included telling remarks from several justices.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a lively Supreme Court argument on Wednesday about what older federal workers must show to prove age discrimination, the justices were unusually engaged. Perhaps that was because they are themselves older federal workers, albeit ones with life tenure.
